direction.raw_text: (honestly) I had nothing to do with it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gave the orders!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did no such thing!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After all I've done for your family - YOU TRIED TO KILL MEEEEEE ! ! ! Rasputin swings the reliquary, wrapping himself in smoke which seems to grow larger. Eerie moaning noises come from the reliquary. PEOPLE back awayin terror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Romanov dynasty ends here! You, your wife and children will all die within the fortnight!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Anastasia leaves Tatiana and rushes to stand in front of her father. Still holding her Music Box, Anastasia's shaking hands are the only thing that gives away her fear. Rasputin spins toward the voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not afraid of you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (furious) You . . .  my little babushka . . . you'll be so much fun to kill that I'll save you for last! Twirling the reliquary again, the MOANS grow louder as Bartok circles around his head. The smoke that emerges seems to have almosy a human shape to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - FOREVER !!!! The tornada of smoke begins again, whipping into a frenzy and then EXPLODING. The smoke clears and Rasputin is gone. As the lights return to normal the Romanov family all stand together, and try to look regal and in control once again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some say Rasputin ad harnessed all the dark powers of evil and that it was his curse which brought about the end . . .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will never know for sure. All I do know is that the beauty of our world was soon Gone . . .  Forever . . . a lick of BRIGHT ORANGE FLAME creeps into view. "RULERS OF RUSSIA"  (VOCAL REPRISE) HUGE, OMINOUS VOCALS reprise the onceglorious watlz of the Romanovs, heralding the end of their world and underscoring the coming revolution. PULL BACK to see the PORTRAIT, a huge FRIEZE which covers an entire entire wall, singeing as the FLAME creeps up the nearby drapery, tinting the room in a red glow. A SCREAMING MOB, some in uniform, some not, has crashed into the palace and is heading up the stairs. A few in the mob fire off orange RIFLE SHOTS. INT. ANASTASIA'S BEDROOM - NIGHT Anastasia BOLTS UP, hearing the shots. Her music box is next to her on her nightstand. INT. HALLWAY - NIGHT Mass confusion as the MOB is met by a few SERVANTS, who try to stop them from advancing. More shots. ON THE ROMANOV'S still in nightclothes, are being rushed down the hallway. Tatiana is next to Anastasia as Anastasia stopsdead in her tracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My music mox! Anastasia turns around and runs back down the hall. Tatiana tries to stop her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anastasia, no! It's too late, Anastasia fights her way back into her room, with Tatiana following her. FROM THE OTHER END OF THE HALLWAY we see Dmitri watching amidst all the confusion. INT. ANASTASIA'S BEDROOM - NIGHT Anastasia grabs her music box as Tatiana rushes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurry, child! LOUD RIFLE SHOTS are heard as Dmitri bursts into the room, closing the door behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No - this way! Dmitri runs to a wall panel and thows his weight against it. It opens, revealing a passage way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go!  Run!!  Out the servant's quarters! Tatiana, enormously grateful, looks at Dmitri as he flips his hair out of his face unconsciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go! Tatiana goes in as Dmitri shoves Anastasia toward the passageway, knocking the music box out of her hand.  She reaches for it, but hearing the mob voices growing closer, he pushes her through the panel without it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go! Tatiana quickly follows Anastasia into the passageway and Dmitri closes the panel JUST AS the mob bursts in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (lying to the mob) No one's here! Let's try the next room! The MOB, accepts the word of a peasant boy and rushes out. Dmitri picks up the music box and looks sadly toward the panel. EXT. TRAIN STATION - NIGHT Which is under siege by ROYALISTS trying to board the overcrowded train and the REVOLUTIONARIES who are trying to stop them. A TOURING CAR pulls up RIGHT ON THE TRACKS behind the caboose as the train starts to pull away. Tatiana and Anastasia climb out of the car and race for the train, fighting their way through the frenzied and frightened crowd. WE HEAR shouts of "The Empress - let her through!" which helps clear the way. Anastasia reaches the train first, then turns to see Tatiana. trying to catch up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurry, Grandmama!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get on! Anastasia, get on! Anastasia refuses to board the train. UP AHEAD A MOB OF REVOLUTIONARIES block the tracks with a TRUCK ON ANASTASIA who pushes Tatiana up the stairs of the caboose. This puts Anastasia a few steps behind as the train speeds up. Tatiana is gripped by other passengers as she reaches out to Anastasia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grab my hand! Anastasia reaches up and takes Tatiana's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't let go! CLOSE ON the TWO HANDS. then suddenly. her small hand is pulled from Tatiana's grasp and falls out of the frame.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: RASPUTIN THIS IS THE END OF THE ROMANOV LINE

dialogue.raw_text: : the ROMANOV FAMILY fades into a PORTRAIT OF THE FAMILY.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: THE OTHER END OF THE HALLWAY

direction.raw_text: ! ON ANASTASIA who has stumbled, hitting the ground hard. ON TATIANA horrified, screaming:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Tatiana rushes to jump off the train after her, but is caught and held back by the ROYALIST PASSANGERS as the train CRASHES through the truck and picks up speed. TATIANA's POV: Anastasia rising from the ground, her hand outstretched. But she is suddenly swallowed up by the mob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never saw her again. . . The PHOTO ALBUM slowly closes. . . END OPENING NUMBER DISSOLVE TO: EXT. ORPHANAGE - DAY A gray and ugly, post-revolution building with a sign above the door that identifies it:  "Young Comrades Without Parents". INT. ORPHANAGE - DAY CHILDREN of all ages clean the cold, gray dormitory. Their clothes are ragged and they look underfed. CLOSE ON ANYA, 18, pretty despite the boy's hand-me-down clothes she is forced to wear, is busy scrubbing the floor. Unlike the others, she is determined not to let her surroundings get to her. She hums a tune. The door suddenly SLAMS open and GREGOR, 8, and clearly terrified, comes running in followed by COMRADE PHLEGMENKOF - a huge woman carrying a switch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anya! Anya! All of the OTHER KIDS turn away, not wanting to get involved.  Anya focuses on Gregor, who  is shivering with fright and on the verge of tears as Phlegmenkof approaches, swinging the switch menacingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't get away from me now . . . Phlegmenkof advances on Gregor.  Anya takes the scrub brush and SHOVES it across the floor, right under Phlegmenkof's unsuspecting foot.  Phlegmenkof's feet fly out from under her and she SMASHES to the floor. Gregor hops over her huge body and runs to Anya for safety. Some of the OTHER KIDS glance over. A CHUBBY GIRL and a very pretty LITTLE GIRL, look at Anya with greeat admiration . . .  someof the OTHERS think she's crazy. Phlegmenkof rises, covered with soap bubbles , and spins on Anya - who gives her a very innocent smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You! You did this! Some of the OTHER CHILDREN laugh as soap bubbles fly off the enraged woman.  She spins on them, her back to Anya.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brats!  There'll be no supper for any of you!  Back to work! Anya, behind Phlegmenkof, mimics her outraged face and angry gestures perfectly - as the CHILDREN laugh harder. Phlegmenkof spins and almost catches Anya.  She advances on Anya as Gregor hides behind her legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't touch him. PHLEGMENKOF (to Anya) You ragged, skinny, little nothing!  I have had just about enough of you . . . Phlegmenkof raises her hand to slap Anya, who hold her ground.  Suddenly, Phlegmenkof SNIFFS the air. ON THE KIDS as the horrible smell reaches them too.  They all make faces and hold their noses. ON PHLEGMENKOF who first sniffs under her raised arm, then realized the cause of the stench . . .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Comrade Serebreakov! She tries to straighten herself out nervously - this must be someone very important. COMRADE SEREBREAKOV stands in the doorway, lecherously eyeing the girls.  He is a huge, fleshly man with facial features which are reminiscent of a fish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (flirting) Comrade Serebreakov!  What a lovely surprise! What brings you here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need. . . a worker. His eye catches Anya. He looks her up and down, his beady eyes showing a touch of lust for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will take her. He leans close close to Anya.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tomorrow you begin your life's work in my hearing factory. You'll start by cutting off the tails - but if I'm pleased with (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: you - you just may move up to cutting off the heads.  How does that sound?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About as bad as you smell! Phlegmenkof moves between them, pulling Serebreakov away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, Comrade - you don't want her . . .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's horrible, skinny thing?! She's crazy - she has no memory of anything before she came here! She didn't even know her name! That one is a rotten troublemaker, willful. . .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll break her will. . . (to Anya) I shall come for you tomorrow at dawn. (he touches her face as she pulls away) You will enjoy serving under me. Smiling in anticipation, he exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't break you - but he can! And she turns to leave in a huff. Anya does one more imitation of her, making the CHILDREN laugh. But as Anya turns away from her audience, we see her facade fade and realize her terror of the future. INT.  ORPHANAGE - NIGHT The CHILDREN huddle in their cots under tattered, thin blankets. Anya is fully dressed, illuminated by the light of a FULL MOON, she ties a dull gray sheets together and anchors the "rope" to an ice cold radiator and throws the other end out of the window.  She is about to climb out when she looks at the sleeping children and smiles sadly. She walks over to Gregor's bed and puts one hand lovingly on his head and then reaches over and takes the hand of a sleeping LITTLE GIRL, who opens her eyes and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (loudly) Anya? The other childern wake up as Anya gently "shushes" him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quietly) Are you running away?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  I'm running to .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Running to? Running to what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To find my home. A CHUBBY TWELVE YEAR OLD GIRL looks at Anya.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you are home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. This isn't a home - it's just a building. Home is where you belong and none of us belong here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is your home, Anya?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sure but look. . . Anya shows Gregor the key around her neck. CLOSE UP on the inscription:  "Together in Paris"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It says "Together in Paris". I was wearing this when I came here ten years ago - it's the only way that I know . . .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat) . . .  that I must have been someone someone loved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is your home in Paris?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It might be. I have to go and find out. Anya smiles lovingly at the children. "A SOMEPLACE AND A SOMEONE" (Anya's "I want" song).  Anya SINGS SOFTLY to the children about how all she has is the key around her neck to the "someone and thesomeplace" she was "lost from long ago".  She tells the children that she must go find them again. UNDERSCORE continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to go now, before it gets light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (worried) But what if we can't ever find where we came from?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then you'll have to make your own home. Lots of people do. Anya embraces the children and walks to the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nervous, sad) Anya! What if we can't find anyone who loves us?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then come find me. Gregor is relieved and cuddles into his bed as Anya smiles lovingly and crawls out the window. EXT.  ORPHANAGE - NIGHT Anya begins to climb down the street, testing the knots. The knotshold tight, but the old sheet RIPS in half, sending her PLUMMETING into a snow drift.  From the depths of the snow we HEAR her voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope there's no snow in Paris. . . EXT.  HILLSIDE - DAWN A glorious bright (and cold) dawn creeps over the horizon. Anya stands at  edge of the hill, looking down on the city of ST.PETERSBURG. The old gray orphanage looms behind her. Anya "borrows" an old, beat-up bicycle from the orphanage and rides down the hill. Music picks up in energy and excitement as Anya zooms on her way bumping and bouncing downhill as the sunrises and St. Petersburg looms nearer. "A SOMEONE AND A SOMEPLACE" (CONT.) Music becomes UPTEMPO, HOPEFUL, ACTIVE, ACTIVE. Anya SINGS - - full of hope, energy and excitement as she peddls her rickety bike toward the city. "Her heart is on its way" and nothing is going to stop her. Anya passes though the countryside toward the city. A peasant family waves to her as she goes by. A Gypsy Troupe performs tricks by the side of the road. A very fancy car zooms by. "A SOMEONE AND A SOMEPLACE" (CONT.) Anya SINGS, imagining who she might be -- anyone from a peasant to a princess! But it doesn't matter as long as she finds her real family. People stare at her as she rides into the edge of the city. She is captivated by all the activity:  cars, busses, stores, long lines of people, etc. "A SOMEONE AND A SOMEPLACE"  (CONT.) Anya SINGS -- in this sea faces, there must be someone who has a clue to her identity.  She'll stop at nothing to find the someone who once loved her.  SOARING MUSICAL AND VOCAL CONCLUSION. END MUSICAL NUMBER Anya does not see a cute little PUPPY (MEETOO) with a HUGE BONE in his mouth, being chased along the sidewalk by a pack of much larger, vicious DOGS until he bolts across Anya's path forcing her to skid to a stop. She watched him as he scoots into an alley, followed by the angry pack. On reflex, Anya drops the bike and reuns into the alley after him. EXT.  ALLEY - DAY Meetoo is trapped.  The PACK surrounds him, ready to pounce when Anya LEAPS into the middle of the circle. The PACK is startled, but begins to advance on both Anya and Meetoo. Anya doesn't know what to do. She crouches and then. . . growls back at them, making her eyes look as ferocious as possible. The PACK exchange a confused look; there's a girl growling at them. Meetoo stands, suddenly brave, behind her and growls along with her. Suddenly, Anya pounced toward the pack, growling louder. The pack has definately had enough - some start to back out quizzically, others turn and run like hell. Anya turns to Meetoo, who looks up at her gratefully, wagging his tail. Anya picks up the bone and puts it back in his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you should be more careful about who you invite to dinner! Meetoo nods and lets out a little "bark" that sounds as if he were saying "retu".  Anya pats him and heads back to her bike. EXT.  ST. PETERSBURG STREET - DAY Anya rides down the street. She doesn't see Meetoo, running like a little maniac behind her. Anya approaches a STERN LOOKING BUILDING with a sign over the door: "The People's Bureau of Bureaucracy". She leaps off her bike and heads up the stais. Meetoo, breathing heavily from his run, follows and almost reaches her when the heavy door slams in his face.  He slumps against it, panting, his little paw-to chest. INT. BUREAU OF BUREAUCRACY - DAY Anya enters and STOPS when she sees. . . LINES and LINES of people which seem to go on forever.  She walks down the side of one line, trying to figure out which one to stand in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could someone tell me. . .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: End of the line!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which line?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All lines are good lines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in unison) In our beloved Soviet Union! They turn toward an armed Soviet Guard and smile sweetly, hoping he heard their flattery.  He did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very good. . . He jots something down in his notebook. ON ANYA as she gets closer to the window. She turns to the person behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this the right line to get papers to travel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Travel? Travel to where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To Paris. I have to get to Paris PEASANT 5, in front of her, turns around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paris?!  What do they have in Paris that they don't have here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shorter lines?! Peasant 6 is immediately carted off by TWO ARMED GUARDS for his blasphamy against the state.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quietly) Nobody leaves Soviet Russia. The OTHER PEASANTS join in with variations of "Nobody leaves Russia" as Anya reaches the window and speaks to the clerk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this where I get traveling papers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It would be if we let you travel which we  don't so it isn't. (loudly, for all to hear) Russia is the people's paradise! And to further make his point, he slams shut his window, which immediately opens a crack as he whispers to Anya.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See Dmitri. He can help. He shuts the window, only to open it again immediately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you didn't hear it from me. He shuts the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (doesn't get it) I didn't He opens it again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. The clerk sticks out a sign:  "Samovar Break - back in ten minutes" and slams the window shut. EXT.  BUREAU OF BUREAUCRACY Anya steps out of the building, still not seeing Meetoo and looks around at the hoards of people waiting in lines for everything:  bread, gas, clothes, etc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to herself) Dmitri? There must be a million Dmitris. . . FOLLOW ANYA as she wades into the crowded street. Meetoo getting tangled in the legs of waiting Soviets. Anya stops suddenly. She sniffs the air.  Her eyes widen as she recognizes the stench that is floating through the air.  She spins around and sees Serebreakov DIRECTLY ACROSS THE STREET. Serebreakov is on a mission to find Anya.  He turns in her direction just as a bus passes.  Anya is gone. We now see Anya clinging to the side of the bus as it drives down the street. Meetoo looks, his face dropping - he knows he'll never catch up to her now.  Then he sees the bus hit a huge pothole and Anya is knocked off into the mud.  Happily, Meetoo trots off in her direction. Anya approaches TWO PEASANTS who are waiting in line in front of a cafe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Peasant 10) Which line is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The line to get into the line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, do you know Dmitri. . . PEASANT 9 I know nothing!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whispering simultaneously) Try the tavern/ library. They begin to bicker back and forth in forced whispers as to wether Dmitri is at the tavern or the library. Exasperated, Anya walks away.  They call after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But we didn't tell you! Anya rolls her eyes in frustration.  She doesn't see Meetoo at her feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (To herself) I wish they'd all stop telling me they didn't tell me! Meetoo gives a "retu" of agreement. Anya looks down and sees him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing. . . Just then, she catches another whiff of something foul in the air. Anya duck quickly into a doorway and loses Meetoo. Anya peeks out. A GARBAGE WAGON full of dead fish and rotten food passes Anya.  She sighs with relief, it wasn't Serebreakov - it just smelled like him. Anya steps out of the doorway and approaches a STREET ARTIST sketching a LARGE PEASANT WOMAN as her TINY HUSBAND looks over his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (To Artist) Could you get rid of her moustache?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me - I'm looking for a man named Dmitri. . . The Artist quickly scribbles and address on his pad and hands it to her without turning around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I didn't write it. Anya looks down at the note CLOSE ON NOTE "St. Petersburg Art Theatre - 99 Pushkin Street"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (over the top) Oh, Grandmama! It's me, Anastasia! I've waited so long to see you! The Actress then LUMBERS over to the OLD WOMAN, with a gait like John Wayne. REVERSE ANGLE to see the "Old Woman" is Vladimir, with a shawl over his head.  He looks older, of course, but with the same dapper mustache. He rolls his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (out to audience) Dmitri!  I can not work with her! (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Actress) May I remind you that you are supposed to be Princess - not a lazy lumbering lout! IN THE SEATS is Dmitri. Now 20 and darkly handsome. His hair still falling in his eyes as he flips it off his forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vladimir, calm down! Vladimir walks off the stage and toward Dmitri.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This, my friend, as an exercise in futility! We shall never find a girl to play the Princess Anastasia out of this motley crew of commoners! Vladimir dramatically throws one end of his shawl over his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For a ten million rubles reward we can look a little longer. This is the big one. . .  and all I need is the right girl. "A SOMEONE AND A SOMEPLACE"  (REPRISE (Dmitri's "I want") Dmitri SINGS a reprise of Anya's song, a COMIC VERSION, in which he expresses the hope that he can find the right girl for his scam. Anyone from a peasant to a princess will do, as long as she can fool Tatiana. (NOTE:   We don't want to give Dmitri a whole new song here or we'll be too song-heavy in Act I. By giving him a short reprise of Anya's song, we can effectively align these two characters emotionally.) QUICK CUTS: of various aspirants:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (heavy hasal) Oh, Grandmama! It's me, Anastasia. I've waited so long to see you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Next!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stupid) Oh. . .  Grandmama it's me. Anastasia, I have waited so long, too. (as a good-bye) See you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Next! ACTRESS 4 looks like a hooker and sounds like Mae West.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. . . Grandmama. . .  It's me. . . DMITRI (O.C.) Next! BACK TO DMITRI DMITRI I wouldn't be on the outside anymore.  The ten million rubles would make me welcome anywhere.  I'd really belong somewhere - if I could just find the right girl. BACK TO QUICK CUTS: A very round ACTRESS 5 ACTRESS 5 Oh, Grandmama. . .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Next!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (very intense) What's my modivation? ON VLADIMIR VLADIMIR (calling out to seats) Stanislavski! CUT TO STANISLAVSKI shrugs innocently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Next! ACTRESS 7 is actually a man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. . . ON DMITRI in a state of disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've gotta find the right girl! END MUSICAL NUMBER DMITRI Next. EXT.  ST. PETERSBURG ART THEATRE Anya rides up to front of the theatre and drops her bike.  She rushes the steps. INT.  THEATRE now empty as Dmitri and Vladimir are gathering up their things to leave.  Vladimir still wears the remnants of the evening clothes that he worein the first scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's no use, Dmitri - we'll never find the right girl!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We will.  We have to. (trying to cheer him up) Come on, Vlad - she's out there. They walk out the door. EXT.  ST. PETERSBURG ART THEATRE - CONTINUOUS DMITRI She could be right under our nose Anya is running up the stairs as Dmitri walks out and they COLLIDE:  her forehead banging Dmitri literally under his nose.  Dmitri grabs his upper lip in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (over reacting) Ouch!  That really hurt!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. . .  I'm. . . DMITRI That's quite a hard head you've got there, boy. In her old hand-me-down boys clothes andhat pulled low, she could easily be mistaken for a boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (breathless) I'm looking for Dmitri.  I need traveling papers - to Paris. I heard Dmitri could help me. Vladimir and Dmitri exchange a look. . .  wary. . .  Dmitri looks around and motions to Vladimir to handle it while he walks ahead nonchalantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who did you hear it from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard it from everyone who said I didn't hear it from them!   Do you know Dmitri? Dmitri keeps walking ahead followed by Vladimir. Anya is determined not to give up and keeps up with Vladimir even though she keeps getting bumped and pulled off track by people walking in the opposite direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (loudly, acting) Providing travel papers is illeagal! (then, quietly) I know Dmitri well - perhaps I can help you.  Providded you have enough money to pay for this service. . . ANYA Well, I don't have any money . . .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good day! Vladimir pats her on the head and walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a bike!  Perhaps I could sell it and. . . Vladimir keeps walking, catching up to Dmitri. Anya runs back around to the front of the building where she left her bike.  She stops suddenly when she realizes that there is no bicycle there anymore - just Meetoo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing here?  And where's my bike? A POLICEMAN strolls by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anya, in a beautiful white dress, is walking peacefully through a sunny part of a lovely forest on a spring day. She reaches down to pick some pretty flowers, then looks up as it seems to get dark... OMINOUS LOOKING CLOUDS cover the sun. Anya reaches down for another flower when she HEARS A GROWL. Anya spins to see an ENORMOUS BEAR emerge from the trees. (All the animals in the dream sequence have a SLIGHT resemblance to Rasputin.) Anya is frozen with fear as MORE BEARS emerge and head straight for her. She tries to back away as the beautiful FLOWERS GROW LONG AND HORRIBLE THORNS and wrap around her ankles, impeding her escape. It gets darker as the BEAR'S EYES, glowing yellow, multiply and move closer. Anya pulls free of the flowers and rushes to the safety of a large tree  She climbs the tree and escapesthe bears. Looking down, from her perch on a sturdy branch, the ground seems miles away. Suddenly, the BRANCH JOLTS her and almost falling, she hold on to it tightly. But the branch TURNS IN TOWARD HER - no longer a tree branch, but A HUGE UGLY SNAKE with red eyes and huge fangs that come right for her! Anya leaps to another branch, which also turns into a snake. She jolts backward and begins to fall ... toward a HUNDRED YELLOW EYES, FIFTY BLOOD RED MOUTHS AND THOUSANDS OF SHARP TEETH. As Anya falls, she lets out a SILENT SCREAM. A BURST OF SUNLIGHT as Anya lands in a field of soft GOLDEN WHEAT. Unharmed and very relieved, she stands and looks around at the beautiful sunny wheat field. INT. CABIN Reality. Anya's eyes are closed as she smiles in her sleep and sits up in bed. TINY WISPS of smoke still swirl around her head. As she gets out of bed, she unintentionally steps on Meetoo's tail, waking him. Meetoo watches as the sleeping Anya opens the cabin door and walks out. Meetoo rises to follow Anya but the ship pitches, sending him sliding across the cabin floor. EXT. DECK - NIGHT Anya walks out on the deck, the ship pitching violently in the storm, as she smiles. IN HER DREAM Anya is walking through the wheat field to the edge of a BLUFF. A few yards below the bluff, Anya sees a beautiful little pond where a FAMILY frolic's in the clear water; laughing, splashing, swiming happily. Anya climbs over a low flowering wall to look closer. PULL BACK REALITY: Anya has climbed over the railing of the deck and is looking into the black ocean... smiling. DISSOLVE TO: A SMOKY IMAGE OF THE SAME SCENE It's RASPUTIN'S POV as he watches his plan unfold in the reliquary. INT. CABIN Meetoo finally rights himself from his slide across the floor and begins to bark into Dmitri's ear. EXT. DECK Anya is waving happily at the dangerous water. IN HER DREAM Anya is waving to the FAMILY. They turn around toward her and she sees that it's the ROMONOV FAMILY, from the frieze that she saw in the palace. She is delighted to see them as she feels a distance recollection of who they are to her. INT. CABIN Meetoo jumps up and NIPS at Dmitri's hand. direction.raw_text: I should go
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That last night in the palace... one boy showed us kindness and courage. You were the boy who saved our lives, weren't you? (Dmitri doesn't answer) Please, is there nothing I can do to repay you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Promise me she'll have her home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And tell me that she's happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Dmitri.I wish that I could. Dmitri comes down the steps, then stops when he sees Anya, wearing her CROWN. She turns and sees him, stifling her first impulse, then putting on a show of supreme confidence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm glad you found what you were looking for.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm glad you        did too. With nothing left to say, he heads for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enjoy your fortune. Dmitri spins, but restrains. He opens the door and Anya goes back into the Parlor. They both know that they will never see each other again. INT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dmitri busily tosses his few possessions into his backpack as Vladimir - in formal attire - waves an embossed INVITATION at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But this invitation came from the Empress herself! It's the social event of the decade! You can't turn it down!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch me. Vladimir starts to protest. Dmitri grabs the invitation and tears it up, tossing the pieces into the air. Vladimir sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So where will you go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She found her home. Maybe it's time I found one too! NEW POV from outside the window. WE DO NOT HEAR THEM, but we see Vlad and Dmitri hug good-bye. PULL RACK to see it's RASPUTIN'S POV; as he stands on a LADDER OF SMOKE, looking into Dmitri's window. Rasputin watches Vladimir leave as Dmitri finishes packing. INT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the windows BURST OPEN and Rasputin swoops in. Dmitri backs away, terrified as the ladder dissolves and smoke fills the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So. You don't want to go to the coronation, eh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rasputin!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, I know ... you thought I was dead. That's how the history books will remember me - not as the ruler of all of Russia, which I SHOULD HAVE BEEN - but as the guy who was never dead when you expected him to be. Dmitri backs away as the smoke coils around him and Rasputin advances.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The same thing I wanted ten years ago - all the Romonovs dead I got the others, now I have to finish up with that nuisance, Anastasia...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're insane! You didn't kill the Romonovs - it was the...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! I DID SO KILL THEM! And I'm going to kill Anastasia. Dmitri lunges for him but the smoke coils around him like rope, holding him back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at me... (Dmitri turns away) Look at me! The SMOKE forms into hands, forcing Dmitri's face toward Rasputin's. Dmitri's eyes widen. Rasputin locks on him with his eyes, glowing like red hot coals, as he bears Dmitri in hypnotically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are going to help me kill her... You are going to help me kill her... her... ON BARTOK who looks away, obviously not enjoying this. As WE HEAR Rasputin repeat "You are going to help me" a few more times. EXT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Magnificently, the Eiffel Tower illuminates all of Paris when FLOOD LIGHTS come on and we see a LARGE PARTY has been set underneath it's black iron legs. WE HEM TRUMPETS as we MOVE IN CLOSER to see that a stage has been set up on the north side, the "Seine side". of the Tower, with a large throne-like chair in the center. Beautiful PARTY GUESTS,  many we had seen in the opening Ballroom scene, mingle around excitedly. Behind the stage, a beautiful curtain separates the party from INT. BEHIND THE CURTAIN the Princess Anastasia, in crown and full coronation gown. Anastasia fidgets nervously, looking for the key around her neck, then remembering it isn't there anymore, as a MAJOR RUSSIAN DOMO addresses her and Tatiana.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... then as I say "Her Serene Highness Princess Anastasia" you, your Highness, should walk out on to the stage and greet your ... Tatiana sees that Anastasia isn't listening and dismisses the Major Domo in mid sentence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe her highness understands what she has to do. Major Domo bows and leaves. Tatiana looks at Anastasia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you, child?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yes, Grandmama - I wait until I hear...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, not about the ceremony, Anastasia - do you understand the choice you must make. Anya turns to her in confusion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no choice... Anya is cut off with a quick knock at the door, as Sophie and Vladimir enter, bowing to them both. Vladimir has Meetoo, all dressed up in bows and ribbons - and looking miserable - on a leash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your "guest" is unable to attend. Tatiana is troubled by this news. Anya starts laughing when she sees Meetoo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Meetoo! You look miserable! Oh, Vlad - look at him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, your highness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poor Meetoo!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, your highness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut it out, Vlad! I'm not angry with you anymore - I know how much you needed the money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But they didn't take the money - either one of them. I offered it to them, but they both refused. Anya is shocked, she takes a minute to process this as
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dmitri didn't want the money?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, he just wanted to know you were happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fortunately, I am to be married. (backing away) With your highness, permission.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vlad, stop acting this way! You're my friend!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. From now on I am your loyal subject ... your highness. By your leave? To Anya's dismay, Vlad and Sophie bow and back out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why does everyone have to act that way?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll have to become used to it, child, if you accept the crown...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "If" I accept?! Of course I'm going to accept! it's what I always wanted!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it? Is this what you want? Tatiana gestures to the formality outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanted to come home, Grandmama - and I did. I came back to my home with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't go back to find your home. Your home is in your heart, in the future that you make for yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And this is my future. This is who I am!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is who you were. Exactly who you are is up to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know who I am! I still don't know!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, you do. You do. Tatiana kisses her on the forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And in your heart, you know what is right for you. Tatiana turns to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've spent my whole life waiting to find you ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we have found each other nothing will ever change that! I am your family, dear child, but I may not be your home. Tatiana leaves. Anya is very torn. Anya jumps as the TRUMPETS sound announcing her entrance. INT. BALLROOM - NIGHT The COURTIERS gather, excited, as the Major Domo readies to make his announcement. INT. ANTE ROOM (EIFFEL TOWER) Anya, thinking about what Tatiana has said, looks at herself in the mirror. ANYA'S POV the Princess Anastasia. But not Anya.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her Serene Highness, the Princess Anastasia! Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: mummers from the crowd outside, various "Where's Anastasia?", then
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anya! Anya spins around, looking for him. His voice seems distant and ghostly,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anya ... Anya follows his voice out of the room and into the ELEVATOR. The doors close. EXT. ELEVATOR as it rises gently to the very top of the Eiffel Tower not on cables - but on long ropes of smoke. EXT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rasputin, gleeful, sits perched on a girder, looking down at the party below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, Bartok. Most of them were there the night I made this curse. Now, they'll get to see it finished! (sighing, content) Revenge is a dish best served... in front of a larrrrrge audience! Rasputin leans over the rail and looks down at the party.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do not despair. I'll make sure your beloved princess drops in. Rasputin chuckles at his own "wit"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahh, very witty. There's this English guy - Noel Coward - I'll bet he's quaking ... ON THE ELEVATOR As the door open and Anya rushes out, looking around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dmitri? Dmitri is standing - like a zombie - at the far end of the platform. Anya sees him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dmitri ... Grandmama told me. She stops. She can tell that something isn't right with Dmitri by the look in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dmitri, what's wrong? Dmitri approaches her slowly, zombie-like, arms outstretched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Throw her off the edge! Do it! Anya looks up at the booming voice. ANYA'S POV sees Rasputin. BACK TO ANYA: FLASHES, RAPID IMAGES: RASPUTIN from the last night at the palace YOUNG ANASTASIA - TERRIFIED ORANGE flash of gunshots YOUNG DMITRI leading them out the wall panel, then the Face of the YOUNG DMITRI superimposes over the zombie who is coming toward her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dmitri ... Look at me! It's Anya! It's ANYA! Dmitri stops. His eyes glazed and frightening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You saved my life in the palace! You won't take it now...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Anya holds her ground as Dmitri moves toward her, ready to push her off the edge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dmitri. I know you would never hurt me. You love me. As Dmitri come close, she moves toward him and kisses him. He blinks and snaps out of it and is quite happy that Anya is kissing him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dmitri?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anya... where are we? WE HEAR a howl from above and suddenly Rasputin jumps down. The reliquary tied to his waist, he's more furious than we've ever seen him - his face literally consumed with rage and hatred. Anya is terrified - but holds her ground as she did when she was a child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess you aren't as powerful as you thought! Rasputin walks slowly toward Anya and Dmitri, burning with rage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll show you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Run, Anya -  go...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not leaving you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fighting for fair lady. How noble... Dmitri pushes Anya away and charges the much larger Rasputin, who knocks his aside with on swoop of big huge arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And how pathetic. Rasputin turns to Anya climbing up a girder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's only going to make you fall farther. Anya turns suddenly and kicks Rasputin in the face, which has the same effect as kicking a brick wall. Anya is thrown off balance and falls. Rasputin pushes her with his foot and she slides across the floor to Dmitri. Anya and Dmitri exchange a quick look as Rasputin, chuckling, advances on them. Anya reaches up and grabs Rasputin's beard, pulling his face forward so that Dmitri can give him a good roundhouse punch. The blow does little but enrage Rasputin. He reaches out and with one huge hand, picks Anya like a rag doll and takes her to the ledge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anya! Dmitri throws himself against Rasputin several times only to get batted away like a fly. Realizing this is futile, Dmitri slips through the FLOOR GIRDERS and scurries towards the edge... BELOW TEM. DMITRI POV: Rasputin's large boots above him, heading for the edge. ABOVE Rasputin reaches the edge, playful dangling the struggling Anya over the side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My curse is now complete! Good-bye, babushka! Anya looks over the ledge. ANYA'S POV The city below as she FALLS. Dmitri emerges from the grid below and GRASS her, holding on to the back of her dress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take my hand! (sees Rasputin approaching) Hurry! She manages to spin around, gripping his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't let me go!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll never let go! CLOSE their hands, gripping one another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a touching sentiment... They look up to see his right above them. Rasputin's boot SMASHES DOWN on Dmitri's hand, which grips the girder. Dmitri screams out        in, but doesn't let go. He looks down at Anya and pulls her up while Rasputin begins to pry off Dmitri's fingers one at a time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This little piggy had a palace... this little piggy had a throne... Anya swings to another beam and now has firm footing as Rasputin continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This little piggy missed the firing squad.. Dmitri is literally holding on with two fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And this little piggy wanted a home... And this little piggy went wee wee wee all the way... down! As Dmitri's last finger is preyed away, he falls but his grasp on Anya's hand is firm and she pulls him onto where she is standing. Rasputin leans over and bends toward them, three feet from Anya.
direction.name: direction
